qas.question: Prior to iOS 5, how many apps were required to play music and videos on iPhone and iPad?
In mid-2010, which Apple device had higher sales than iPod?
With what iOS release did Apple standardize media apps on all their products?
In what year did iPhone sales surpass those of iPods?
What are the titles of the standard media apps on current Apple devices?

context: Before the release of <a2_0>iOS 5<a2_0/>, the iPod branding was used for the media player included with the <a1_0>iPh<a0_0>one<a1_0/><a0_0/> and iPad, a combination of the Music and Videos apps on the iPod Touch. As of iOS 5, separate apps named <a4_0>"Music" and "Videos"<a4_0/> are standardized across all iOS-powered products. While the iPhone and iPad have essentially the same media player capabilities as the iPod line, they are generally treated as separate products. During the middle of <a3_0>2010<a3_0/>, iPhone sales overtook those of the iPod.
